definition: to undertake/to carry/to shoulder/to take responsibility
picul (100 catties, 50 kg)/two buckets full/carrying pole and its load/classifier for loads carried on a shoulder pole
"hand" radical in Chinese characters (Kangxi radical 64), occurring in 提, 把, 打 etc
dawn/morning/daybreak/day/dan, female roles in Chinese opera (traditionally played by specialized male actors)
to hold a governmental office or post/to assume office of/to take charge of/to serve as
to share (a burden, a cost, a responsibility)
carrying pole and the loads on it/burden/task/responsibility/CL:副[fu4]

sentences.english: Your hair has been God to count, you have the burden enough for you Tam.
sentences.chinese: 你的头发已被神数算，你的重担足以替你担。

sentences.english: In the afternoon she expressed some anxiety for Georges.
sentences.chinese: 下午，她为乔治担着不少焦急。

sentences.english: Dissolution of primary wall appears at the neck of sterigma.
sentences.chinese: 担孢子与担子的小梗连接处出现初生壁溶化现象。

sentences.english: To quote Spider - Man's late uncle : "With great power comes great responsibility."
sentences.chinese: 正如蜘蛛侠的最新名言“揽大权者担重任。”
担孢子无色，光滑，椭圆形。

sentences.english: The burden of sincerity in Christ lies squarely upon those men who are called as true workmen of God;
sentences.chinese: 那些神呼召的真正工人身上担着基督里的信实。

sentences.english: All have burden could go to Lord, He must rest us.
sentences.chinese: 凡劳苦担重担的可以到主那里，他定使我们得享安息。

sentences.english: Am I responsible for the dirty air in Beijing?
sentences.chinese: 那么，我是否该为北京污浊的空气担一份责？

sentences.english: You had better neglect your relations, than run the risk of offending your patroness.
sentences.chinese: 免得担那么大的风险，得罪了你的女施主。

sentences.english: Arbitration fees shall be borne by the losing party , unless otherwise awarded.
sentences.chinese: 仲裁费，除另有规定，由败诉方担。

definition: carrying pole and the loads on it/burden/task/responsibility/CL:副[fu4]
to raise aloft with both hands/(of two or more people) to carry sth together
to carry on one's shoulder/(fig.) to take on (a burden, duty etc)
carrier who carries heavy loads on his shoulder (dialect)
to transport on pack animal/to carry (a load on one's back)
